FuncDef:
The load-balance user-group refer-service-location command enables a device to check the active/standby status of service-locations.
The undo load-balance user-group refer-service-location command disables a device from checking the active/standby status of service-locations.
By default, a device does not check the active/standby status of service-locations when performing the load balancing function in the scenario where multiple user groups are configured in the AAA domain and bound to a NAT instance. The device load-balances traffic based on the number of users bound to the NAT instance by default.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the load-balance user-group refer-service-location command is run on a device, the device is enabled to check the active/standby status of service-locations when performing the load balancing function in the scenario where multiple user groups are configured in the AAA domain and bound to a NAT instance.
Configuration Impact
The load balancing algorithm is affected when multiple user groups are configured in the AAA domain and bound to a NAT instance.
